summary: Build/update a study-tracker style app UI/UX: dark blue dashboard theme, animated/illustrative icons and graphics, editable subject/chapter details with delete options, improved graphs/graph animations, notifications for incomplete/today tasks, fix overlapping panels with blur/backdrop, enable horizontal scrolling icons, add light/dark mode toggle, and ensure persistent saved data across app restarts/resets.
architectural_notes: Introduce app-wide theming system (light/dark + custom palette) with consistent component styles.
Implement persistent storage for user data/state so changes survive app close/restart/reset.
Use a modal/overlay management pattern (backdrop blur, z-index layering, focus/scroll locking) to prevent panel overlap issues.
known_issues: Chapter details/other panels overlap the main panel; details are not visible and UI layers get mixed.
Main bottom icons are not scrolling horizontally as expected.
User changes/data appear to reset after closing or resetting the app (persistence issue).
Last build/deploy attempt failed ('AI was unable to complete your request').
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Abstract dark blue mesh gradient background (app-bg-mesh-blue.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Seamless subtle blue noise texture (app-bg-noise-blue.dim_2048x2048.png)
- Minimal line-art study illustration (study-illustration-line.dim_1200x400.png)

existing_features.title: Apply a dark-blue dashboard/background look across all main dashboards (Home/Dashboard, Calendar, Subjects, Notes, Tests) using a cohesive, accessible color palette for cards, text, borders, and accents; keep user-facing text in English.
Add subtle, consistent icon animations throughout the UI (hover/tap/active + state-change) that work on both desktop and mobile, and respect prefers-reduced-motion.

Introduce background and opening-interaction graphics/illustrations (lightweight SVG/PNG assets) that enhance the dark-blue theme, including subtle background visuals and small decorative graphics when opening panels/screens, without obscuring content.
Ensure every subject detail area provides an in-place edit option to update: (a) number of lectures, (b) target hours, and (c) date to finish (where applicable), with immediate persistence.
Add delete actions for every chapter and every subject anywhere they appear in the UI (not only in customization), including confirmation prompts and consistent destructive styling.
Use clear, consistent colors/indicators for completion vs incompletion across chapters/todos/graphs, and ensure these indicators are visible in lists, detail panels, and charts.
Add a Notifications section on the Home/Dashboard page that, when opened/viewed, shows (1) all incomplete work items and (2) work due today, displayed in two clearly separated lists.

Fix overlapping/mixed UI layers by ensuring any opened panel/drawer/sheet is fully readable and does not visually overlap the main content incorrectly; use a backdrop blur overlay and correct z-index layering for panels like the Chapter detail sheet.
Implement a user-facing Light/Dark mode toggle in Settings/Customize that switches between light mode and dark mode and persists the preference across reloads.
Ensure the bottom navigation icons area scrolls horizontally on small screens so all icons are reachable via swipe/scroll, with visible affordance when overflow exists.

Improve and expand graph usage and animations: add graphs where they are naturally required (e.g., completion trends, subject completion distribution) and enhance existing chart animations/transitions while respecting prefers-reduced-motion.
Guarantee that user changes (edits, completion marks, deletes, settings) persist across app close/reopen and refresh; do not reset data unless the user explicitly confirms a destructive reset action.

new_feature_requests.summary: Apply dark blue background theme to dashboard and other dashboards with cohesive color palette for all components
Add icon animations throughout the app
Add graphics/illustrations for screens, opening interactions, and background visuals
Add inline edit options on subject details to edit number of lectures, target hours, and finish date
Use illustrative icons in as many appropriate areas as possible
Add graphs where required and improve graph animations across the app
Add delete option for every chapter and subject
Add distinct colors/indicators for completion vs incompletion states
Add a Notifications section on Home showing (a) all incomplete works and (b) tasks due today, separated
Fix UI overlays/panels: chapter details tab (total lectures/target hours/etc) should be fully visible; use background blur/backdrop and prevent overlapping/mixed panels throughout app
Make the main bottom icons area scroll horizontally so all icons are accessible
Add Settings toggle for Light/Dark modes (customizable two-way switch)
Ensure persistent data: user changes should remain after closing or resetting the app; reopen should reflect latest state
